meanings.definition: A person who gives a fee or fief.
meanings.sent1: The feoffer handed over the land to the new owner.
meanings.sent2: The feoffer was known for his generosity in granting land.
meanings.sent3: The feoffer decided to play a game where he pretended to give away imaginary kingdoms.
meanings.sent4: She was a true feoffer, bestowing gifts of land like a benevolent ruler.
meanings.sent5: The feoffer's act of granting fiefs was like a colorful tapestry of generosity.

meanings.definition: To give a fee or fief to someone.
meanings.sent1: He will feoffer the estate to his loyal friend.
meanings.sent2: She feoffers the land to those who have served her well.
meanings.sent3: The siblings decided to feoffer each other their favorite toys as a sign of love.
meanings.sent4: The sun feoffers its warmth to the earth every day.
meanings.sent5: The magician feoffers magical abilities to those in need, like a mystical gift-giver.
